intro: Schmidelia viticifolia, commonly known as the grape-leaved schmidelia, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It features slender, branching stems covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are heart-shaped and resemble grape leaves, hence its common name. Schmidelia viticifolia is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
